lecture2.question: Outline of Acts
lecture2.answer:
Acts Outline:
  • 1:1–8:1 — Church in Jerusalem
  • 8:2–12:25 — Church in Judea, Samaria, and Antioch
  • 13:1–14:28 — 1st Missionary Journey (NE Med)
  • 15:1–35 — Jerusalem Council
  • 15:36–18:22 — 2nd Missionary Journey
  • 18:22–21:16 — 3rd Missionary Journey
  • 21:17–28:31 — Jerusalem to Rome

lecture4.question: In which chapter is the Pentecost event found?

lecture5.question: Identify the chapter: “Salvation is found in no one else”

lecture6.question: Identify the chapter: “We must obey God rather than men”
Identify the chapter: Choosing of the seven deacons
Identify the chapter: Stoning of Stephen

lecture7.question: Identify the chapter: Philip and the Ethiopian
Identify the chapter: Three chapters of Saul's conversion
Identify the chapter: Peter’s first food vision

lecture8.question: Identify the chapter: “Believe in the Lord Jesus Christ and you will be saved”
Identify the chapter: Paul's Areopagus speech

lecture9.question: Identify the chapter: Apollos first appears
Identify the chapter: Paul and disciples of John the Baptist

lecture10.question: Identify the chapter: “the whole counsel of God”
Identify the chapter: “For two whole years Paul stayed there in his own rented house ... and boldly and without hindrance preached the Kingdom of God.”

lecture11.question: Outline of Romans
lecture11.answer:
Romans Outline:
  • 1:1-7 — Opening
  • 1:8-15 — Thanksgiving and Travel Plans
  • 1:16-17 — Theme
  • 1:18-5:21 — Justification
  • 6-8 — Sanctification
  • 9-11 — Israel - Has God's Word Failed?
  • 12:1-15:13 — Hortatory
  • 15:14-33 — Travel Plans
  • 16 — Greetings and Closing

lecture12.question: Identify the chapter: “I am not ashamed of the gospel”
Identify the chapter: “the wrath of God is being revealed ... and men are without excuse.”

lecture13.question: Identify the chapter: “Gentiles ... show the requirements of the law written on their hearts”
Identify the chapter: “there is none righteous, no not one.”

lecture14.question: Identify the chapter: “all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God and are justified freely by his grace.”

lecture15.question: Identify the chapter: Adam / Christ comparison

lecture16.question: Identify the chapter: “the wages of sin are death, but the gift...”
Identify the chapter: “the law is spiritual but I am fleshly”
Identify the chapter: “all things work together for good”

lecture17.question: Identify the chapter: “It is not as though God’s word has failed”
Identify the chapter: “Did not know Righteousness of God and sought to establish their own”
Identify the chapter: “Christ is the end of the law.”
